issue.title: Task-3 Steps are uneven and to small

content.raw:
Building codes also have a tolerance for measurements, often 3/8 inch. The bottom step is about 3/8 inch taller than the middle steps, which is within that tolerance. The top step is a little more than an inch shorter than the middle steps, but I would expect shorter steps to be more manageable than unexpectedly tall steps, since they are less of a tripping hazard.

These dimensional variations help demonstrate the robustness of each team's solution to the stair climbing task.
